t: What Is Amazon Family? - Amazon Customer Service
s: Amazon Family allows you to easily manage all your shared services, subscriptions, and digital content from one place. You can manage profiles or linked accounts to share benefits and control access to services and content for kids and teens. Amazon Family allows you to share Amazon benefits ...

t: Create Your Amazon Family - Amazon Customer Service
s: You can create an Amazon Family to share Prime benefits and a Family Library with another adult, up to four teens (who were added before April 7, 2025), and up to four children.

t: Share Amazon Prime with Your Family - Amazon Customer Service
s: Learn how to set up an Amazon Prime family account and share your benefits with your family members.

t: Add an Adult to an Amazon Family - Amazon Customer Service
s: Amazon Family requires a unique Amazon account for each adult. If the other adult doesn't have their own Amazon account, they can create one either when they accept their invitation or when they sign up with you.

t: How to use Amazon Family to manage digital content and share select Prime benefits with your family members
s: March 7, 2025 - To access the Amazon Family hub, simply go to your account settings by selecting “Accounts & Lists” in the upper-right hand corner of your browser, then select “Your Account” and “Your Amazon Family.” In the Amazon Shopping app, tap the “Me” tab, and then select “Your Account,” ...

t: Amazon Brand Registry | Sell on Amazon
s: In some cases, you may also enroll with a pending trademark registration. See country-specific requirements (login required). You must be the trademark owner. If you are an authorized agent, have the trademark owner enroll the brand, then add you as an additional Brand Registry account user.

t: Leave an Amazon Family - Amazon Customer Service
s: After you leave an Amazon Family, only the primary Amazon Prime member will keep Amazon Prime benefits. You'll no longer have access to shared content in the Family Library. You can only switch to a new Amazon Family every 12 months.

t: Amazon (AMZN) owns a whole collection of secret brands, USPTO trademark filings reveal
s: July 20, 2022 - You've probably been buying way more things from Amazon than you realize.

t: What Prime Benefits can Adult Amazon Family Members Share? - Amazon Customer Service
s: To share Prime benefits and digital content between adults, both adults must link their accounts through Amazon Family and agree to share payment methods. Both adults will keep their own personal account while sharing Prime benefits.

A Household allows you to connect and share Amazon benefits with the whole family. Two adults and up to four teens and four child profiles may link in a Household. Two adults in a Household can share digital content and if they are Prime members, Prime benefits.

t: Manage Kids' Account via Amazon Parent Dashboard - Amazon Customer Service
